title: China’s Long March 6A rocket appears to have an orbital debris problem
summary: The upper stage of China’s Long March 6A rocket appears to be creating numerous pieces of space debris, adding to the growing issue of orbital debris.

title: Rocket Report: Chinese firm suffers another failure; Ariane 6 soars in debut
Hubble Measures the Distance to a Supernova
summary: Measuring the distance to truly remote objects like galaxies, quasars, and galaxy clusters is a crucial task in astrophysics, particularly when it comes to studying the early universe, but it’s a difficult one to complete. We can only measure the distances to a few nearby objects like the Sun, planets, and some nearby stars directly. […]

title: Earth from Space: Hainan Strait
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission takes us over the Hainan Strait in southern China.

title: ESA Mars Earth Return Orbiter Passes Key Milestone
summary: The European Space Agency announced on 5 July that its Earth Return Orbiter had passed a key milestone with the completion of its critical design review. ESA’s Earth Return Orbiter (ERO) is the agency’s primary contribution to NASA’s Mars Sample Return mission, which aims to bring soil, rock, and atmospheric samples from Mars back to […]

title: SpaceX Falcon 9 Suffers In Flight Engine Failure, Starlink Payloads Lost
summary: SpaceX Falcon 9 Suffers In Flight Engine Failure, Starlink Payloads Lost

title: Falcon 9 suffers upper stage engine failure
summary: The engine on the upper stage of a SpaceX Falcon 9 malfunctioned during a launch July 11, causing the potential loss of a batch of Starlink satellites and creating repercussions across the space industry.

title: Lunar spacecraft receive dozens of collision warnings
summary: Even a few spacecraft in orbit around the moon can create dozens of warnings of potential collisions that require several maneuvers to avoid.

title: NASA Remembers Retired Astronaut, US Air Force Pilot Joe Engle
summary: Retired NASA astronaut and U.S. Air Force Maj. Gen. Joe Engle died July 10, surrounded by his family at home in Houston. Among his many honors, he is the only astronaut to pilot both the X-15 and space shuttle. He was 91. Engle became an astronaut at age 32 while flying the X-15 for the […]

title: Microsoft leads $40 million funding for Starlink networking startup
summary: Armada has raised an extra $40 million through a Microsoft-led funding round to develop mobile data centers tailored for SpaceX’s Starlink broadband network, the San Francisco-based startup announced July 11.
